task_summary: The robot locates, grasps, and pulls open the oven door by interacting with its handle, ensuring the container (oven) is open before releasing and retreating.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a manipulator arm operating in a kitchen environment to open the oven door. The robot must first perceive and visually confirm the position of the oven door handle, then approach and align with it precisely. After securing a side grasp, the arm executes a deliberate pull movement to open the hinged door, monitors the state to confirm opening, then releases the handle and retreats. No other kitchen contents are manipulated. The task restricts the robot to gentle interaction, uses visual and force feedback, and is staged to minimize the risk of collision or incomplete opening.
preconditions: Oven door handle is visible or can be localized
stepwise_plan: Check if oven door handle is visible; retry scan if necessary
Detect and localize oven door handle
Approach and align gripper to oven door handle
Grasp handle firmly enough for pulling
Pull handle along prescribed direction to open oven door
Check if oven door is open
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: repeat scan up to limit
Pull movement blocked: abort or adjust direction
Door does not open: verify grasp and repeat pull
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends after successful retreat from handle following opening of oven door.
